channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 19
item.description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel vowed to address climate change after touring the “surreal, ghostly” scene of a German village destroyed by flooding. (The Atlantic)  Read: The truth behind the Amazon mystery seeds.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Facebook and Biden in War of Words Over Vaccine Misinformation
item.description: Facebook has taken steps to limit the spread of vaccine misinformation—such as removing posts that promote vaccine lies—but the Biden administration thinks those actions have been toothless.   WH Press Secretary Jen Psaki said health misinformation on social media is “leading to people not taking the vaccine, and people are dying as a result.” More than 97% of new hospitalizations from the Delta variant are of people who’ve not been vaccinated, the agency said.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Icebreakers With...NFL Legend Ndamukong Suh
item.description: It’s one of those things where I don't think you need to bet all of your money on one thing, but I do think you need to have exposure to it. I had to ask myself, “How do I understand what a budget is?” I remember back in the day a long snapper named Don Muhlbach was one of the few guys in the locker room I would talk to about finance, where he was at with his business, and who he aspired to be. Four sacks in a playoff game or a Super Bowl win—that’d be the best. Some of them I've already accomplished so that’s probably why I didn’t pick them.  No. 1 draft pick Trevor Lawrence is getting his signing bonus paid out in cryptocurrency.  There’s for sure more conversations on those topics in the locker room compared to 2010 when I first got in the league. I don’t see myself putting my salary fully into bitcoin. If you could own one building what would it be? Now, it’s on Reddit and you see all the news about GameStop so I think it’s seen as more “cool” to talk about it and be in the know.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Money Matters: How Many Credit Cards Is too Many?
item.description: Credit card rewards can pack a serious punch. —Eduardo from New YorkThe question isn’t how many credit cards you should have, but rather how much of your total credit limit you’re using. If you have just one credit card with a $1,000 limit, stay sub-$300, even when you pay in full and on time. How many credit cards should I have, and is it OK to close one if I never used it and have no balance?
item.author: Ryan Lasker

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 17
item.description: 97% of people hospitalized due to Covid-19 are unvaccinated. CDC Director Rochelle Walensky said that the Delta variant is spreading quickly among unvaccinated people in the US.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: US Warns Companies on Rising Risks of Operating in Hong Kong
item.description: In a business advisory issued yesterday, the US government listed the threats US companies in Hong Kong might face:Electronic surveillance and compromised data securityRisks regarding transparency and access to critical business informationDeteriorating press freedomA new Chinese national security law that targets political dissidentsLooking ahead…the advisory won’t demand specific actions from private companies.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: Secretary Yellen to Meet With Other US Regulators to Discuss Stablecoin
item.description: During next week’s meeting, Secretary Yellen and other regulators will ask themselves: If there is no oversight of these US dollar-backed coins, what does that mean for the OG US dollar? It’s a coin that is—in theory—more stable than other cryptocurrencies like bitcoin, ether, etc.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: 'Space Jam' Reboot Offers a Grand Tour of Warner Bros. IP
item.description: This is not a review of the film Space Jam: A New Legacy, which opened in US theaters and on HBO Max yesterday.  This time, Warner Bros.  Warner Bros. It is a review of how Warner Bros. As Jake Harris writes in the Book and Film Globe, “Everyone’s got to have a cinematic universe these days, after all.”
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Biogen's Alzheimer's Drug Continues to Face Backlash More Than a Month After Approval
item.description: On Thursday, influential hospitals Cleveland Clinic, NYC’s Mount Sinai Health System, and Providence in Washington State said they wouldn’t administer Aduhelm, citing concerns over its effectiveness and safety. the blowback has been so bad that the acting FDA chief has ordered a federal investigation to explore the perhaps too-cozy relationship between the scientists who approved the drug and the drugmaker, Biogen. An Alzheimer’s drug hadn’t been approved by the FDA in 18 years.  Some experts who helped the FDA evaluate Aduhelm protested the decision.  The FDA’s approval of the drug, called Aduhelm, was met with widespread criticism.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Make It Work: Tips on Getting a Job at the Brew (or Anywhere Else)
item.description: Our core values are super important to us and I can almost guarantee you that you'll be asked about them during the process. I'm looking for a job, and Morning Brew just posted one that matches exactly what I want! It goes a long way and has a lasting impression on us Brew folks.  Wishing you the best of luck in your job search. Each week, Morning Brew's Head of People Ops Kate Noel answers reader-submitted questions about work in 2021. Ask Kate here.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 16
item.description: (Cold Takes) Read: All possible views about humanity’s future are wild. In a thread bashing the industry, Palmer called the crypto world a “cult-like ‘get rich quick’ funnel designed to extract new money from the financially desperate and naive.”
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Several MBA Programs End Hybrid Learning This Fall
item.description: But because Zoom U can’t replicate networking off the Dalmatian Coast, students sued universities and asked for their money back.  Kate Kirsch, an incoming Harvard MBA student, told the WSJ: “So much of the value of the MBA program is the people.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: Aurora Announces IPO to Bring Autonomous Semi Truck To Highways
item.description: Aurora is SPACing to raise money and commercialize its self-driving tech. In January, the company acquired Uber’s self-driving unit and now has 1,600 employees. Eventually, the company wants to get its tech into more vehicles, including ones that move humans.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Revolut $800 Million Funding Round Signifies Hot Fintech Market
item.description: Fintech investing > other kinds of investingWhen you say, “Invest in my new fintech startup,” investors say, “How much?” The company was valued at $11 billion and its listing was a huge win for the burgeoning fintech industry the country has been trying to birth since Brexit.  Klarna, the Swedish buy-now-pay-later company responsible for the staggering amount of Girlfriend exercise dresses in your closet, snagged a $46 billion valuation last month.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Aurora Announces IPO to Bring Autonomous Semi Truck To Highways
item.description: Aurora is SPACing to raise money and commercialize its self-driving tech. Eventually, the company wants to get its tech into more vehicles, including those that move humans. Autonomous vehicle startup Aurora announced plans yesterday to go public via SPAC at a valuation of $11 billion.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Several MBA Programs End Hybrid Learning This Fall
item.description: But because Zoom U can’t replicate networking off the Dalmatian Coast, students sued universities and asked for refunds.  Kate Kirsch, an incoming Harvard MBA student, told the WSJ: “So much of the value of the MBA program is the people. Not worth the money?
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: Revolut $800 Million Funding Round Signifies Hot Fintech Market
item.description: Fintech investing > other kinds of investingWhen you say, “Invest in my new fintech startup,” investors say, “How much?” The company was valued at $11 billion and its listing was a huge win for the burgeoning fintech industry the country has been trying to birth since Brexit. After an $800 million funding round, Revolut, a London-based fintech startup, is now the biggest private company ever in the UK with a valuation of $33 billion.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.description: (Cold Takes) Read: All possible views about humanity’s future are wild. In a thread bashing the industry, Palmer also called the crypto world a “cult-like ‘get rich quick’ funnel designed to extract new money from the financially desperate and naive.”
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Candace Parker Will Be First WNBA Player on NBA2K22’s Cover
item.description: Bottom line, via Parker: “Being able to see women on the cover, visible in leadership positions, it helps not just in sport but also just in the boardroom, in business, or everything,” she told Bloomberg.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: The EU and China Launch Ambitious Plans to Cut Greenhouse Gas Emissions
item.description: some of the most powerful world leaders will meet in Glasgow in November for the UN Climate Change Conference to pitch even more initiatives.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 15
item.description: Quote: “The medals will not be given around the neck. (No Mercy/No Malice) Read: How fintech is eating the world. Literally.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Drug Overdose Deaths Rose Nearly 30% Last Year
item.description: The surge is pronounced on the West Coast; in San Francisco for instance, about 64% more people died of drug overdoses last year than from Covid-19. Drug overdose deaths rose nearly 30% nationwide in 2020 to a record of 93,331, according to preliminary federal data.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Twitter Cancels Its Fleets Feature
item.description: Twitter’s VP of product said, “In the time since we introduced Fleets to everyone, we haven’t seen an increase in the number of new people joining the conversation with Fleets like we hoped.”
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Expanded Child Tax Credit Kicks in Today
item.description: In the biggest win for parents since the invention of the iPad, the IRS will send supersized checks for the expanded child tax credit (CTC) beginning today. Will it stick around?  Here’s why: The expanded child tax credit is expected to cut child poverty by nearly half, according to a study from Columbia University. Read it here. “It’s the most transformative policy coming out of Washington since the days of FDR,” Booker claims.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Drug Overdose Deaths Rose Nearly 30% Last Year
item.description: The surge is pronounced on the West Coast; in San Francisco for instance, about 64% more people died of drug overdoses last year than from Covid-19. Drug overdose deaths rose nearly 30% nationwide in 2020 to a record of 93,331, according to preliminary federal data.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Twitter Cancels Its Fleets Feature
item.description: Bottom line: Twitter hopes other new product releases, like its live audio feature and Clubhouse competitor, Spaces, will be less fleeting.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.description: In November, some of the most powerful world leaders will meet in Glasgow for the UN Climate Change Conference to pitch even more initiatives.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: What's Up With the Child Tax Credit?
item.description: Taxpayers who claimed the child tax credit on their 2020 returns—or 2019 for those who haven’t yet filed for 2020—should be all set to receive monthly payments. The monthly max payment is $300 per child under 6 and $250 per child between ages 6 and 17. Until then, chat up a tax pro if:Your income increased significantly in 2021You’re concerned about a higher-than-usual tax bill next yearYou take turns with someone in claiming the child tax creditYour child turns 6 or 18 in 2021You’re too late to unenroll from the first payment, but you can discontinue the rest here. Parents who aren’t required to file taxes can sign up for payments on the non-filer portal. You’ll get the max payment when your AGI is below... You’ll get something when your AGI is below:$240,000 and you’re single$440,000 and you’re married filing jointly$240,000 and you’re a head of householdYou can calculate exactly how much you’ll get here. The IRS is looking back at your most recent return to calculate your monthly payment, but the actual tax credit amount is based on your 2021 situation. They’ll get the other half when they file their 2021 taxes next year.
item.author: Ryan Lasker

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 15
item.description: Quote: “The medals will not be given around the neck. (No Mercy/No Malice) Read: How fintech is eating the world. Literally.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Expanded Child Tax Credit Kicks in Today
item.description: In the biggest win for parents since the invention of the iPad, the IRS will send supersized checks for the expanded child tax credit (CTC) beginning today. Read more: Our personal finance writer Ryan Lasker put together a cheat sheet for the child tax credit that’ll help you figure out if you qualify, how much you’re eligible for, and whether you should opt out. Will it stick around?  Here’s why: The expanded child tax credit is expected to cut child poverty by nearly half, according to a study from Columbia University.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Candace Parker Will Be First WNBA Player on NBA2K22’s Cover
item.description: Bottom line, via Parker: “Being able to see women on the cover, visible in leadership positions, it helps not just in sport but also just in the boardroom, in business, or everything,” she told Bloomberg.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Young Streaming Platforms Rake In 2021 Emmy Nominations
item.description: Netflix accounted for about 60% of all streaming nominations in 2020, but this year, its share is down to less than 40%. Netflix sat alone at the top for a while, nabbing the all-time nomination record last year with 160. All the whippersnappers with strong Emmys showings revealed impressive viewership gains this year.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 14
item.description: (GQ) Read: Jason Sudeikis is having one hell of a year. Bloomberg’s Joe Weisenthal has the jokes for the boom in used car prices.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Apple Reportedly Working On a Buy-Now-Pay-Later Service
item.description: Apple currently earns a cut of every Apple Pay purchase, so the more users buy, the more it makes. The service will work with any Apple Pay-enabled card, so no Apple Card is required. Goldman Sachs, which is already Apple Card’s partner, has been tapped as the service’s lender.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: JPMorgan, Goldman Sachs, and PepsiCo Kick off the Earnings Season Strong
item.description: Consumers are "raring" to spend more this summer (great for JPMorgan’s credit card biz), but the company’s trading revenue dropped sharply in Q2 as the economy opened up. Their confidence is up.” However, while people are getting out more, “they are not anywhere near where they were,” Johnston said.
item.author: Sherry Qin
